aboutClinic.descText: A multidisciplinary clinic in Moscow with modern diagnostics and expert specialists. The uniqueness of the clinic lies in combining medical knowledge with wisdom and an individualized approach to every patient. We treat not just the disease, but the person — considering their character, physiological characteristics, and needs. Every specialist at the clinic, in addition to their primary specialization, has experience working with oncology patients and maintains oncological vigilance. Thus, diagnostics and treatment in the clinic are carried out at the highest level, taking into account knowledge of prevention, early detection, treatment, management, and additional examinations for all patients, including oncology patients. Attentive care, refined through years of experience, in diagnosing and treating all conditions is our priority! We work with all patients professionally, without unnecessary anxiety, with confidence at every step.

doctors.title1: A modern multidisciplinary outpatient clinic. A wide diagnostic and treatment base
doctors.title: Our Doctors
doctors.subtitle: Our approach is based on evidence-based medicine and interdisciplinary collaboration. Each clinical step is evaluated taking into account the patient's medical history: we choose safe examination methods, plan treatment without increasing risks, and coordinate tactics in medical consultations. Our priority is safety, consistency, precision of actions and respect for the patient. The long-term experience of specialists working with patients, including after oncological diseases, allows them to correctly assess the condition after surgery, chemotherapy and radiation therapy, and take into account the specifics of drug interactions and limitations in diagnosis. We are here to carefully understand the situation and offer an informed, safe solution.

doctor1.services: In-person and remote consultations, international oncological board, high-tech surgical treatment
doctor1.desc:
A doctor who takes on the most complex cases. Dr. Soma is not only a brilliant surgeon specializing in head and neck tumors, but also the founder of the Eurasian Oncology Program (EAFO), which unites doctors from different countries for experience exchange. In the operating room he is precise, in conversation — open, and in life — inspiring.
    • Oncologist, surgeon, maxillofacial surgeon, ENT specialist, plastic surgeon
    • Specialization: head and neck tumors, skin, thyroid and breast cancer, lymph node dissection, oncoplasty
    • President and founder of the Scientific and Educational Center “Eurasian Oncology Program” EAFO
    • Head of reconstructive and oncoplastic surgery projects
doctor1.aboutText:
Oncologist, surgeon, maxillofacial surgeon, otorhinolaryngologist, plastic surgeon, healthcare organizer

Professional interests include: surgery for salivary gland tumors, including nerve-sparing procedures; surgery for parotid gland tumors; thyroid tumor surgery; surgical treatment for skin, melanoma, and soft tissue tumors of any localization and complexity with reconstruction; surgery for oral cavity and oropharyngeal tumors; sentinel lymph node biopsy for melanoma and breast cancer; surgeries for hypopharyngeal and laryngeal tumors, including tracheoesophageal shunting; skull base surgeries; reconstructive and oncoplastic operations; all types of lymph node dissections for metastases in cervical, axillary, and inguinal regions; breast cancer surgery and breast reconstruction.

reviews.name: Semyon (Moscow)
reviews.text: I was looking for a remote consultation option as a second opinion for relatives. Since there are many such services, it’s hard to choose! I was advised to contact Dr. Soma. The administrator was attentive and didn’t give the impression of trying to sell the service. She explained everything clearly. I was told what documents to send and what data to include. The result of the consultation came in a few days. As a result, the relatives decided to come for further examination and treatment under Dr. Soma’s supervision. The administrator even helped with accommodation options, which was unexpected.

reviews.name: Anna (Saint Petersburg)
reviews.text: I want to share my impression of Dr. Soma! I was looking for a good specialist who could answer all my questions clearly, leaving no doubts about further actions. After reviewing all my documents, Dr. Soma ordered an additional test, after which I understood exactly what I needed to do next. Most importantly, I felt that there’s a doctor who takes responsibility and monitors my condition, which brings peace of mind. He explains everything clearly and objectively, without loud or empty words. His team is organized, responsive, and attentive to detail. I’ve contacted Dr. Soma’s team several times — their professionalism inspires trust.

reviews.name: Mikhail (Barnaul)
reviews.text: Dr. Soma is a very experienced specialist with over 25 years of professional practice. He spends a lot of time consulting patients and is very patient despite his busy schedule. His vast experience allows him to make accurate diagnoses and provide expert conclusions.

doctor3.aboutText:
V. M. Nechushkina is a highly qualified surgical oncogynecologist, proficient in a full range of state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic methods, and in all the surgical procedures used in modern oncogynecology, performed by both abdominal and laparoscopic approaches.
Head of Oncogynecology at Health-Direct.
Chair of the International Oncology Board at Health-Direct.
Deputy Director for Science and Chief Researcher at the Autonomous Nonprofit Organization 'Scientific and Educational Center “Eurasian Oncology Program”' (EAFO), Moscow, Russia.
Chair of the Eurasian Working Group on Gynecologic Oncology and member of the Expert Council of the Eurasian Federation of Oncology (EAFO).  
  Professor, Department of Oncology, Radiation Therapy, and Radiology, Privolzhsky Research Medical University, Nizhny Novgorod.
Her professional interests include:
  • surgical treatment of cervical cancer (stages I–II), including with neoadjuvant and adjuvant chemotherapy;
  • fertility-preserving treatment for cervical cancer (stages I–II), including extended trachelectomy for tumors over 2 cm;
  • ultraconservative treatment for cervical cancer with primary tumors up to 2 cm;
  • surgical treatment of uterine body cancer, including pelvic and lumbar lymphadenectomy;
  • cytoreductive surgery for advanced uterine body cancer;
  • surgical treatment of advanced borderline ovarian tumors, including organ-preserving surgery;
  • surgical treatment of recurrent borderline ovarian tumors;
  • surgical treatment of ovarian cancer, including full staging for early disease;
  • extensive and combined surgery for advanced ovarian cancer (stages III–IV);
  • surgical treatment of recurrent ovarian cancer;
  • placement of ports for intraperitoneal chemotherapy;
  • pelvic exenteration.

Her treatment approaches are based on the latest international randomized studies and meta-analyses and are compliant with European and American guidelines for oncogynecological diseases.

doctor3.scientific:
Professor V. M. Nechushkina is the author of more than 200 publications in Russian and international scientific journals, co-author of 7 manuals, 1 textbook, 2 patents, 7 guidelines, and over 20 clinical recommendations, as well as more than 180 scientific reports in Russian and English.

She has translated and edited official publications and educational materials for WHO, ESTRO, ESO, ESMO, IAEA, ARCA, the Eurasian Federation of Oncology (EAFO), and the following medical publications:
  • Bulletin of N. N. Blokhin Russian Cancer Research Center (including annual special supplements on cancer statistics in Russia–CIS: 2005–2011);
  • General Practice by Murtagh, McGraw-Hill, 1998;
  • Novak’s Gynecology (12th edition), Williams & Wilkins, 1996;
  • Manual of Obstetrics by Niswander & Evans, Little, Brown and Company, 1996;
  • Manual of Allergy and Immunology by Lawlor, Fisher & Adelman, Little, Brown and Company, 1995;
  • Smith's General Urology (15th edition), Lange Medical Books/McGraw-Hill, 1995;
  • Quarterly Journal 'World Medicine Standards';
  • The New Consultation: Developing Doctor-Patient Communication, Oxford University Press, 2003;
  • Color Atlas of Emergency Department Procedures by Custalow, Elsevier Inc., 2006;
  • Colposcopy of the Cervix, Vagina, and Vulva by M. S. Baggish, Mosby, 2003;
  • Trauma Manual (4th edition) by Moore, Mattox & Feliciano, McGraw-Hill, 2003.


Teaching Activity
  • 2011–2015 – Associate Professor, Department of Oncology and Radiation Therapy, Faculty of Medicine, Pirogov Russian National Research Medical University.
  • 2015–2020 – Professor, Department of Oncology and Radiation Therapy, Faculty of Medicine, Pirogov Russian National Research Medical University.
  • 2016 – Certificate of academic title 'Associate Professor' in Oncology, Ministry of Education and Science of the Russian Federation.
  • 2019 – Visiting Professor, Chinese University, Hong Kong.
  • 2020–present – Professor, Department of Oncology, Radiation Therapy, and Radiology, Privolzhsky Research Medical University, Nizhny Novgorod
  • Prof. Nechushkina has participated in more than 200 scientific conferences, seminars, and congresses (in over a quarter of them as a member of the organizing/scientific/program committee). She is a regular invited lecturer at national and international congresses, including abroad (Hungary, Netherlands, India, Italy, China, USA, Turkey, France, etc.).
  • Since 2009, she has held over 20 training events in different countries:
    • interactive seminars in Krasnoyarsk, Smolensk, Khabarovsk, Voronezh, and other cities in Russia;
    • as part of surgical master classes, Professor Nechushkina demonstrated and taught the most complex oncogynecological surgeries in Hungary (Budapest), Hong Kong, Kazakhstan (Almaty, Astana), India (Chennai), China (Guangzhou), Russia (Vladivostok, Izhevsk, Moscow, Nizhny Novgorod, Orenburg, Samara, Tomsk, Cheboksary, Chelyabinsk, Cherkessk, Yaroslavl).


H-index: 13 (Google Scholar)


i10-index: 22 (Google Scholar)

reviews.name: Ekaterina (Nizhny Novgorod)
reviews.text: I am very happy that we were recommended Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina in Nizhny Novgorod—many doctor acquaintances said there is no one better. I was terribly afraid of surgery and ready to refuse treatment, but after talking with Valentina Mikhailovna, I immediately trusted her. I quickly gathered all tests and came for a personal meeting. After our conversation, I calmed down and agreed to hospitalization. The surgery lasted 9.5 hours and after it, the entire staff was by my side. Every day I communicated with the team and was amazed at how attentive and positive the doctors were and how kind and caring the nurses were. I gradually recovered by the sixth day and am preparing for discharge. I have only positive impressions of the Soyuz Clinic and its work. Huge thanks for saving me. I thank God I ended up here. The clinic employs real professionals and heartful people who care about patients’ recovery. The surgery was of the highest quality. Thank you for saving me.

reviews.name: Ekaterina (Novomoskovsk)
reviews.text: I sought help from Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina. Stage 4 ovarian cancer. Interval cytoreduction was performed. The operation lasted more than 8 hours! She managed to remove all tumor and metastases with the highest quality! She is not just a doctor but an angel who fights to save patients. Deep gratitude and long happy life wishes to her! I never regretted turning to her. She and her team are the best doctors! Currently recovering post-surgery and starting next chemotherapy course. Recovery is successful! After surgery, I walked from ICU to ward on my own! The doctors constantly monitored me in ward and ICU. Dressings every day, no pain at all! Valentina Mikhailovna personally visited and answered all questions! Now I hope for successful treatment and long remission!

reviews.name: Svetlana (Moscow)
reviews.text: Thank you for the golden hands of surgeon Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina. Deep gratitude to her and the whole team who took part in my surgery. I appreciated the attentive and gentle attitude toward patients.

reviews.name: Elena (Moscow)
reviews.text: Once again, I express my gratitude to Valentina Mikhailovna! Four years after her surgery. Cancer was complicated. I am especially grateful to God and her that she was the one treating me (the surgery was on 23.07.2020 at Kulakov Institute). Before surgery, another doctor warned me about statistics: five-year survival rate in my case was 20%. But four years have passed. Properly performed surgery is extremely important (I realized this during chemotherapy at Blokhin). I am deeply grateful! At Blokhin Institute, all doctors I met (ultrasound, chemotherapy, lab) proudly said they had the happiness to work with you and that you are the best professional in this surgery field. If you read my review—I am endlessly grateful to you and Alexey Sergeevich who recommended only you as the best professional!

reviews.name: Irina (Moscow)
reviews.text: Valentina Mikhailovna is a wonderful doctor and person; she provided great professional, moral, informational support. Her empathy and compassion for the patient is striking. Wonderful, cohesive team work.

reviews.name: Yana (Ramenskoye)
reviews.text: All doctors are professionals, sensitive and attentive, you feel you are in reliable hands, thank you very much!

reviews.name: Karina (Moscow)
reviews.text: Excellent team—qualified specialists, attentive and responsive. Brilliant surgeon, Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina, who performed my surgery. Very attentive surgeon who observed me post-surgery—Timur Ravshanovich. Treatment fully met my expectations.

reviews.name: Svetlana (Moscow)
reviews.text: I write this review a year after surgery and rejoice. I am alive and healthy! This second chance at life was given by wonderful doctor Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina and her team. My story began in autumn 2022 with an acute abdomen, difficulty breathing, scapula pain, abdominal swelling. Examination revealed unfortunate diagnosis—stage III high-grade ovarian cancer with ascites. Oncology dispensary suggested chemotherapy then surgery. I searched for a surgeon. Thank God I met an acquaintance who recommended the International project "Health-Direct" and the Eurasian Oncology Program (EAFO), consulting the best oncologists. So I came to Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina. She explained everything in detail (including diagrams) about the diagnosis, consequences, and treatment. Successful treatment depends on primary complete cytoreductive surgery, followed by chemotherapy. Leaving the office, I felt like on wings. After signing the contract, I was in the hands of a professional team focused on results. Attentiveness and kindness of doctors and the possibility of staying in touch at all stages impressed me. The complex surgery lasted 11 hours removing 14 items including liver ligament, uterus with adnexa, metastases with rectum, greater omentum, spleen, pancreas, stomach wall, gall bladder, appendix. Later I learned such surgeries involve multi-specialists: abdominal surgeons, urologists, etc. World-class surgeons Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina and Kirill Alexandrovich Shemyatovsky performed full cytoreduction. Deep gratitude to surgeons, project leader Dr. Soma, anesthesiologist Aleksey Olegovich Prikhodchenko, intensivists Oleg Vladislavovich Baydal, Pavel Viktorovich Vyatkin, nurses, secretaries. Wishing them all well-being and health!

reviews.name: Anna (Kirov)
reviews.text: I treated for three years in my city with wrong diagnosis and treatment, while disease progressed... Once I turned to Health-Direct, correct diagnosis was made promptly and surgery with further treatment proposed. Tests and a coordinator monitored me and guided through the process. Then I was admitted to the clinic, prepped, operated, stayed a week in excellent conditions, and was prescribed follow-up treatment on discharge. I want to sincerely thank the entire cohesive team of doctors; each is a professional and a kind, caring person. I am happy fate led me to these people! Special thanks to Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina, Kirill Alexandrovich Shemyatovsky, Aleksey Olegovich Prikhodchenko, Oleg Vladislavovich Baydal, Dmitry Yuryevich Sinyavin, Timur Ravshanovich Safarov, all nurses with golden hands, and everyone who contributed to my treatment! Deep respect!

reviews.name: Anastasia (Kaliningrad)
reviews.text: I was suspected to have cervical cancer in private clinic. I kept retaking many tests, ultrasounds; doctor couldn’t confirm diagnosis. A friend who survived cancer gave me Valentina Mikhailovna’s contacts. I live in another region, face-to-face consultation was hard, but couldn’t wait. Remote consultations are very convenient. I sent all documents ahead, manager forwarded them to doctor, I was told what further tests to pass and documents to get from prior treatment hospital. By consultation, Valentina Mikhailovna had all documents, so conversation was to the point, she explained everything thoroughly and answered all questions. Most importantly, my diagnosis was not confirmed. Thus, in one hour, a competent specialist solved all problems without unnecessary charges and manipulations.

reviews.name: Irina (Balashikha)
reviews.text: I was skeptical about private medicine as the same specialists work in government and private clinics. But when at Balashikha cancer center they ignored me and delayed treatment, I reconsidered. Reviews made clear very few surgeons try to thoroughly remove tumors and prevent recurrences. If you face ovarian cancer and read this review, believe me, Valentina Mikhailovna is top-notch, don’t waste time. It’s been a year since my surgery and I live a full life. Thanks!

reviews.name: Ekaterina (Saint Petersburg)
reviews.text: Huge gratitude to Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina and her professional team. Stage 4 ovarian cancer was diagnosed. At Petrov Institute, chemotherapy came first due to widespread cancer. I sought a second opinion and booked remote consultation with Valentina Mikhailovna—immediately felt she was pleasant and polite, explained risks, and recommended operation first. I trusted her. The process was well organized with a doctor remotely supervising pre-op exams. Surgery was long but I woke without pain. Next morning, I sat up in ICU with doctor’s support, surprisingly quick recovery compared to my prior myoma surgery. Walking started next day and continued well. Anesthesia team’s work was outstanding. Only drains caused discomfort but were removed gradually. By day 5, I walked clinic grounds, day 7 discharged with chemo recommendations. All was clear, comfortable, and excellent. Huge thanks to all doctors!

reviews.name: Svetlana (Murmansk)
reviews.text: Very impressed by doctors’ full attention, responsibility, and day and night support. Surgery was difficult but the experienced staff provided prompt help; I felt positive even in ICU. Such care is true professional medical aid. Glad I ended with doctor Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina and her team. A month post-surgery, I am active and energetic. A great team for treatment. Wishing all good health and kindness!

reviews.name: Maria (Krasnogorsk)
reviews.text: Huge thanks to Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina! She operated on me for stage 3 ovarian cancer last December! Surgery lasted 11 hours; 2 days in ICU. Began walking, eating, drinking quickly post-op; hardly any abdominal pain! Everything went very well with Valentina Mikhailovna and her team! By day 8, I was home, then chemotherapy. Now CA-125 is normal! No signs of disease per tests! Deep gratitude to Valentina Mikhailovna! A godsend doctor!

reviews.name: Antonina (Moscow)
reviews.text: I want to sincerely thank Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina! Three years ago she saved my life! Advanced ovarian cancer, stage 3! Surgery lasted 10 hours, plus chemotherapy. No progression now. Living fully thanks to her. Rarely meet doctors you can discuss surgery aftermath and decisions with. Meeting her relieved all fears, I agreed to surgery. She is highly educated and fascinating—a true professor! If she is your doctor, trust her; she’s the best! Patients and doctors alike confirm—‘You made the right choice!’ Doctors say: ‘Very good surgery’, ‘She was born with scalpel in hand!’ Dear Valentina Mikhailovna, God bless you and your team! Many thanks to Dr. Soma, Kirill Alexandrovich Shemyatovsky, Aleksey Olegovich Prikhodchenko, Pavel Viktorovich Vyatkin, Oleg Vladislavovich Baydal. God bless!

reviews.name: Marina (Ussuriysk)
reviews.text: My review aims to express huge thanks to a talented doctor and help women facing oncology make the right choice to save lives. I'll be happy if my review saves even one life. Cancer patients often hear, ‘We are not gods...’ Maybe so, but not about wonderful surgeon, gynecologist, oncologist Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina. All patients and colleagues say: ‘She’s second only to God! Valentina Mikhailovna is the hands of God in our world!’ Diagnosed with stage III ovarian cancer with peritoneal metastases in Feb 2022. Terrified and confused how to start treatment, living in a small town with previous regular checks but late diagnosis due to negligence or low doctor professionalism. Life depended on surgeon’s professionalism. Blessed I found Valentina Mikhailovna! You immediately feel safe with her. After thorough evaluation and long consultation, surgery lasted 9 hours. Local surgeon was shocked seeing discharge papers ‘Wow you had half your abdomen removed!’ But I remain alive thanks to Valentina Mikhailovna and team. Post-op she guided chemo and genetic tests, found hereditary gene mutation, prescribed expert treatment unknown locally, monitors my course, is always reachable day or night. Dear women facing similar situations: don’t hesitate—only Valentina Mikhailovna. She’s unsurpassed, confirmed by patients and doctors. Other doctors praise her surgery and skill. Dear Valentina Mikhailovna, God bless you and your team! Sincere thanks to Dr. Soma, Kirill Alexandrovich Shemyatovsky, Aleksey Olegovich Prikhodchenko, Pavel Viktorovich Vyatkin, Oleg Vladislavovich Baydal. God bless!

reviews.name: Svetlana (Kolomna)
reviews.text: My family suffered misfortune: ovarian cancer diagnosed. Local hospital queues, delayed tests, and bad reviews caused stress. Husband found a doctor through a friend who advised Health-Direct. It felt like a different world. Clear plan given first by phone. First, met Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina in person. Skeptical about reviews, but after five minutes knew she was the right doctor. Consultation lasted three hours; she patiently answered questions without hurry or condescension. First impression: my doctor! Within five days, completed 19 complicated diagnostics thanks to Health-Direct managers. Most frightening was surgery, but Valentina Mikhailovna reassured. Long-term collaboration with the same anesthesia team ensures great results. Next day after surgery, I could sit and walk around ICU. Transferred to my room, care continued. Simple things like hydration, walking, diet, and social interaction quickly restored me. Immense gratitude to Valentina Mikhailovna and her team!

reviews.name: Evgeny (Arkhangelsk)
reviews.text: Huge thanks to Aleksey Olegovich! He brought me back to life, and thanks to him I am still here. He is a doctor from God, both as a specialist and as a wonderful person. Wishing him health and success in his challenging work!

reviews.name: Aleksandr (Nizhny Novgorod)
reviews.text: It is rare for doctors to write about their colleagues, but in this case I had to. It's always frightening to treat a loved one, especially when there is a life-threatening illness in an elderly person with a history of health issues. My mother was diagnosed with endometrial cancer with lymph node metastases and had recently undergone emergency stenting of her coronary arteries. Valentina Mikhailovna Nechushkina said surgery would be possible only if the anesthesiologist-intensivist gave the green light. I expected to hear 'not possible in this state' from the consultation, but the result with Aleksey Olegovich Prikhodchenko was unexpected. He was attentive, thoughtful, quickly established rapport with my mother, didn't scare us, clearly explained the risks, and agreed to prepare her for the necessary surgery. His knowledge in therapy and cardiology was impressive. Extra diagnostics and preparation didn't take much time and my mother underwent the scheduled surgery. Aleksey Olegovich's excellent anesthesia work and brilliant post-op care meant that the very next day my mother was sitting up, and another day later — already walking, despite her recent heart surgery! Heartfelt thanks to Aleksey Olegovich Prikhodchenko and his colleagues Pavel Viktorovich Vyatkin and Oleg Vladislavovich Baydal for their care! I sincerely admire these doctors. Thank you from me and my mother!

In her work, nothing is arbitrary — every treatment strategy is carefully devised, taking into account the tumor’s molecular features, comorbidities, and the patient's real quality of life.
Patients appreciate her thoughtful approach, clear explanations, and ability to support them at every stage of therapy.

reviews.name: Nikolay (Kolomna)
reviews.text: In November 2023 I was diagnosed with stage III cancer of the right lung. Life seemed to end. I was already preparing for death. Thankfully, smart and sensible people nearby advised me to contact Health-Direct. That month flew by like a fast train, and only now do I realize how much had to be done and why. We got confirmation that the cancer was only in the lung. Then I went for more testing to find out what kind of cancer I had. After all this, I received my first chemotherapy session in December. Chemotherapy was administered by oncologist Dmitry Yuryevich Sinyavin, who also supervised my care. He is a very attentive and responsible doctor. I had a total of six chemotherapy sessions. After four sessions, based on the oncology board’s decision, Dmitry Yuryevich advised radiation therapy. I underwent 30 sessions. One month after that, a CT scan showed positive progress. This gave me hope, but the last two chemotherapy infusions were difficult for me. It turned out that a whole team of doctors was involved, and they got me to my last session on time. Now, I am completely cancer-free! Looking back at the past six months, I am immensely grateful to oncologist Dmitry Yuryevich Sinyavin, radiotherapist Aleksandr Evgenyevich Pankratov, and the entire Health-Direct team for the correct treatment plan (it was very different from what would have been given where I live)! More such doctors, please! Thanks to you, I can go on living and see my newly born granddaughter grow up!

services.title: Our Services
services.subtitle:
Multidisciplinary clinics in Moscow and Makhachkala with advanced diagnostics and expert specialists.
Our medical centers bring together professionals from various fields to provide comprehensive care under one roof. From initial consultations and preventive screenings to complex diagnostic procedures, every patient receives personalized attention and evidence-based treatment recommendations.
Equipped with cutting-edge technology, our clinics ensure early and accurate detection of diseases, allowing patients to begin treatment without delay.

s1.title: Specialist Consultation
s1.subtitle: In-person and Remote Consultations
s1.about:
You can receive this service through an in-person meeting with an expert or submit a request for a remote online consultation if you are in another region and cannot come in person. In addition, you can obtain a written opinion regarding the course of the disease, diagnosis, and an individualized treatment plan based on the provided medical documentation.

An expert consultation is necessary immediately after being diagnosed with a 'malignant neoplasm' to effectively plan examinations and treatment. It can also serve as a second opinion. Only a properly structured, step-by-step treatment program ensures maximum results without complications or unnecessary anxiety for patients and their families, providing recovery from cancer or, at the very least, maintaining quality of life and extending its duration.

Getting an in-person appointment with leading experts in specialized medical institutions is extremely difficult. Health-Direct provides the opportunity to obtain an expert opinion from such specialists in the field of oncology both in person and remotely.

For the consultation, you will need to prepare and upload all available medical documentation in your personal account: discharge summaries, laboratory and instrumental test results.

As a result, you will receive an expert opinion on the necessary additional examinations, diagnosis, or a verified personalized treatment plan.

Duration: 60 minutes.

s2.title: Individual Early Disease Diagnosis
s2.subtitle: Individual Early Disease Diagnosis
s2.about:
A cancer diagnosis always disrupts the usual course of life for any person, their relatives, and loved ones. To stay one step ahead and rule out oncological and other life-threatening diseases, we offer a comprehensive health check-up.

Individual Early Disease Diagnosis at Health-Direct

The service consists of the following stages:
  1. Remote consultation with an oncologist who will assess risks, identify potential health threats based on medical history, and prescribe an examination plan.
  2. The examination can be completed independently, or the Health-Direct team will organize it with top specialists.
  3. In-person consultation with an oncologist who, based on test and examination results, will provide an accurate assessment of your current health condition regarding the presence or absence of oncological diseases and predispositions. You will also receive a comprehensive evaluation that identifies accompanying conditions.

Mandatory tests include:
  • Complete blood count (used to diagnose anemia, blood disorders, acute infectious diseases, etc.);
  • Biochemical blood test (used to assess the functional state of organs and systems such as the liver, kidneys, etc.);
  • Comprehensive lipid profile (used to assess the risk of developing atherosclerosis and cardiovascular events such as myocardial infarction or stroke);
  • Coagulogram (used to diagnose blood clotting disorders);
  • Tumor markers (performed when indicated).

In addition to tests, your doctor may recommend instrumental studies, which may include:
  • Ultrasound of pelvic organs;
  • Ultrasound of abdominal organs;
  • Ultrasound of mammary glands (for women);
  • Ultrasound of cervical lymph nodes;
  • Mammography (for women);
  • Gastro- and colonoscopy (with or without sedation);
  • Low-dose CT scan of the chest;
  • Dermatoscopy;
  • Cytological and/or histological examination (if necessary);
  • Additionally, the doctor will perform a detailed examination of the skin, checking for the presence and size of moles, freckles, and birthmarks.

Individual early diagnosis is essential for people who care about their health, understand that it is much easier to prevent a disease than to treat it, and for those who have previously overcome cancer and recognize the importance of a personalized approach and well-planned examination.

s3.title: International Oncological Board
s3.about:
The oncological board is a mandatory requirement before starting specific treatment (according to Order No. 116n dated February 19, 2021, 'On the procedure for providing medical care to the adult population for oncological diseases'). A high flow of patients in public healthcare institutions and heavy workloads on hospital laboratories often lead to irreversible consequences: mandatory boards become a mere formality, examinations are not carried out in full. Patients are forced to turn to private clinics, undergo fragmented tests, and as a result, lose precious time.

Why is a board needed?
  • to confirm or refute the diagnosis of a malignant tumor;
  • to adjust an already prescribed treatment or examination plan;
  • to develop an effective treatment strategy;
  • to obtain a second expert opinion;
  • to ensure the correctness of the ongoing treatment.


Which oncological diseases are reviewed at the board?

At the international oncological board of Health-Direct, a multidisciplinary team of specialists discusses the diagnostic, treatment, and follow-up strategies for the following diseases:
  • malignant tumors of the head and neck (laryngeal cancer, nasopharyngeal cancer, thyroid cancer, parotid gland cancer, pharyngeal cancer, etc.);
  • melanoma of the skin and other localizations;
  • stomach cancer;
  • lung cancer;
  • adrenal cancer;
  • esophageal cancer;
  • prostate cancer;
  • rectal cancer;
  • cervical cancer;
  • endometrial (uterine body) cancer;
  • ovarian cancer;
  • Hodgkin's lymphoma;
  • non-Hodgkin lymphomas;
  • brain tumors;
  • breast cancer;
  • male breast cancer;
  • gallbladder cancer;
  • anal canal cancer;
  • skin cancer;
  • liver cancer;
  • pancreatic cancer;
  • colon cancer;
  • soft tissue sarcomas.


A malignant tumor may be accompanied by conditions such as diabetes mellitus, hypertension, previous myocardial infarction, stroke, and other chronic diseases. In such cases, a comprehensive approach is required to determine the treatment strategy and predict possible complications in order to prevent them.

The board involves specialists needed at different stages of specific antitumor treatment: surgical oncologists, chemotherapists, and radiotherapists.

Who makes up the international oncological board of Health-Direct?

Your case will be reviewed by experienced doctors and candidates of medical sciences: at least two surgical oncologists, two radiotherapists, and three chemotherapists, as well as an anesthesiologist-resuscitator who will assess the tolerability of various treatment methods based on your health condition. Our team will carefully study your medical history, test results, and conclusions to select the optimal treatment plan.

The Health-Direct project engages not only domestic experts but also international practicing physicians, expanding the patient’s opportunities to receive treatment both in Russia and in partner foreign clinics, in accordance with global standards and treatment protocols.

Permanent members of the international oncological board of Health-Direct:
  • Nechushkina Valentina Mikhailovna – Chairperson of the International Oncological Board of Health-Direct, oncologist, surgeon, obstetrician-gynecologist, Doctor of Medical Sciences, Professor;
  • Snegovoy Anton Vladimirovich – oncologist, chemotherapist, Doctor of Medical Sciences, Professor;
  • Kononenko Inessa Borisovna – oncologist, chemotherapist, Candidate of Medical Sciences;
  • Sinyavin Dmitry Yurievich – oncologist, chemotherapist;
  • Dzhugashvili Maya Shalikoevna – oncologist, radiotherapist, Candidate of Medical Sciences;
  • Valkov Mikhail Yurievich – oncologist, radiotherapist, Doctor of Medical Sciences, Professor;
  • Novikov Sergey Nikolaevich – oncologist, radiotherapist, Doctor of Medical Sciences, Professor;
  • Subramanian Somasundaram – oncologist, surgeon, plastic surgeon;
  • Prikhodchenko Alexey Olegovich – anesthesiologist-resuscitator, Candidate of Medical Sciences.


What documents are required for the board?

To conduct a remote board consultation, you need to attach all available medical documentation to the application:
  • discharge summaries of prior treatments;
  • oncologists' reports;
  • records of surgical procedures;
  • results of radiological examinations (CT, MRI, PET-CT);
  • results of laboratory and other instrumental studies from diagnosis to the present moment;
  • histological and cytological examination reports.


How is the oncological board conducted at Health-Direct?

The patient’s in-person presence is not required. You can be anywhere in the world. The supervising doctor prepares a presentation of the clinical case. Experts study the attached documents in advance. In a closed session, specialists discuss your case and develop an optimal diagnostic or treatment strategy.

Diagnosis and treatment recommendations are made strictly in accordance with international protocols and standards for the treatment of malignant tumors.

As a result, you will receive the conclusion of the International Oncological Board of Health-Direct in the shortest possible time and gain the opportunity to proceed with additional examinations and specific treatment in one of the specialized medical institutions, either public or private, under the supervision of an assigned specialist.

s4.title: Chemotherapy
s4.about:
Center for Modern Antitumor Drug Therapy

Drug therapy for malignant neoplasms is the treatment of oncological diseases using medications aimed at destroying or restraining the growth of cancer cells. In our clinic, we combine international standards of oncological care with attentive and caring attitude towards each patient. Our team provides modern antitumor treatment based on scientific evidence and clinical experience, creating all conditions for comfortable therapy.

We accompany the patient at every stage — from diagnosis to recovery, helping to maintain quality of life and inner balance.

Accurate diagnosis is the foundation of successful treatment.

At HDMC, the diagnostic process is organized in accordance with international clinical protocols. Patients undergo a full range of examinations — laboratory, instrumental and molecular genetic studies, imaging methods (MRI, CT, PET/CT) — quickly, safely and in comfortable conditions. This approach allows not only to determine the stage and characteristics of the tumor, but also to select personalized therapy specifically for your type of disease. All decisions are made collectively at the oncological council.

We pay great attention to informing the patient and their family — we explain in detail all stages of therapy, possible side effects and methods of their prevention.

Modern methods of drug therapy

HDMC uses all modern types of antitumor drug treatment.
The choice of method is always individual — depending on the type and stage of the tumor, concomitant diseases and the patient's general condition.
The main goal of therapy is to maximally effectively affect the tumor while maintaining quality of life.

Chemotherapy

Chemotherapy remains one of the main methods of treating malignant tumors.
Its task is to stop the growth and spread of tumor cells.
At HDMC, chemotherapy is conducted according to international protocols, with precise selection of dosages and administration regimens. We use both classical and modern drugs with improved tolerability profiles. Treatment is accompanied by supportive therapy that helps minimize side effects — nausea, weakness, reduced immunity.
Patients are under constant supervision of doctors and nurses, and all procedures are performed in the comfortable conditions of a day hospital.

Targeted Therapy

Targeted therapy acts on specific molecules involved in the growth of tumor cells. Such treatment works selectively, almost without affecting healthy tissues. Before prescription, molecular genetic testing of the tumor is performed to determine the presence of targets for targeted drugs.
This allows selecting treatment that is maximally effective for this particular patient.

Advantages:
  • high precision and selectivity of action;
  • lower toxicity compared to classical chemotherapy;
  • possibility of long-term use without hospitalization;
  • maintenance of usual lifestyle during treatment.

Immunotherapy

Immunotherapy helps the body fight the tumor on its own by activating its own immune system. HDMC uses modern drugs — immune checkpoint inhibitors and monoclonal antibodies acting at the cellular mechanism level. Immunotherapy can be used both independently and in combination with other methods. It has the potential for long-term disease control and formation of sustainable antitumor immunity with good tolerability.

Endocrine Therapy

Endocrine (hormonal) therapy is used for tumors sensitive to hormones — for example, breast cancer or prostate cancer.
The goal of treatment is to block the effects of hormones that stimulate tumor growth.
Treatment is conducted in the form of tablet preparations or injections, often — on an outpatient basis. Endocrine therapy is easily tolerated, suitable for long-term use and allows patients to maintain their usual active life.

Supportive Therapy

Supportive therapy is an integral part of treatment at HDMC.
It is aimed at maintaining quality of life, preventing and correcting possible side effects.
We apply:
  • antiemetic therapy;
  • prevention of neutropenia and anemia;
  • nutritional support (individual nutrition);
  • pain control;
  • psychological support.

Oncological treatment is a journey that requires not only professionalism but also support. We accompany patients and their loved ones at every stage: from diagnosis to the recovery period.
The HDMC team is always available — to answer questions, adjust therapy and help maintain confidence in recovery.

Call by phone: +7 (499) 685-30-00

s5.title: Placement of a Venous Port System for Chemotherapy
s5.subtitle: Venous Port System Placement
s5.about:
What is a port system?

A port system consists of a catheter placed into a central vein and a chamber to which the catheter is connected. It is implanted under the skin in the subclavian area. For prolonged courses of chemotherapy, this is the most optimal option for comfortable treatment. In addition, a port system can be used for blood sampling, prolonged antibacterial therapy, parenteral nutrition, and/or frequent blood transfusions. Like any catheter, a port system can be used to administer contrast agents for MRI and CT or to deliver any intravenous medications.

Possible contraindications for port system placement

Placement of a port system is recommended by the physician based on clinical data and the treatment plan. Each case is considered individually, since all listed contraindications are relative. However, implantation should be approached with caution in the following cases:
  • blood clotting disorders;
  • individual intolerance to port materials;
  • radiation therapy at the intended implantation site;
  • superior vena cava syndrome;
  • inflammation of the skin at the implantation site;
  • sepsis.

How is port system placement performed?

The procedure for placing a port system is not considered an operation and takes 30–90 minutes. The implantation site is disinfected, a local anesthetic is administered, the vein is punctured and the catheter is inserted. A small skin incision of no more than 3–4 cm is made, a subcutaneous pocket is formed, and the port system is placed in it. The incision is closed with cosmetic sutures, which fully heal within 2–3 weeks. The implantation site is protected with a special dressing that can be removed by the patient later.

What does the patient feel after the procedure?

The port system is perceived by the body as a foreign object, so pulling, aching and tingling sensations at the implantation site are normal. People have different pain thresholds; to reduce discomfort, painkillers prescribed by the treating physician can be taken immediately after implantation if necessary. Discomfort should completely subside one week after the procedure. Any unpleasant sensations are a reason to contact a physician immediately.

Also, in the early period after port implantation it is recommended to limit certain routine activities:
  • avoid lifting heavy objects (over 5 kg) for 7 days;
  • limit visits to pools, baths, and saunas for 14–28 days;
  • refrain from intense physical exercise for 7 days.


How to prepare for the procedure?
  • Consult with the specialist who will place the port system and discuss timing and location of implantation.
  • Prepare and provide the physician with copies of tests and examinations:
  • complete blood count with leukocyte formula and platelet count – valid for 14 days;
    • - complete urine analysis – valid for 14 days;
    • - biochemical blood tests (total protein, glucose, total bilirubin, creatinine, urea, ALT, AST) – valid for 14 days;
    • - coagulogram (fibrinogen, APTT, INR) – valid for 14 days;
    • - blood group and Rh factor – valid for 3 months or after the last transfusion if one was given within the last 3 months (on a form with an original stamp);
    • - phenotype – valid for 3 months or after the last transfusion if one was given within the last 3 months (on a form with an original stamp);
    • - anti-erythrocyte antibodies – valid for 3 months or after the last transfusion if one was given within the last 3 months (on a form with an original stamp);
    • - tests for infectious diseases: RW, HBs antigen, antibodies to HCV, HIV – valid for 3 months;
    • - electrocardiogram (ECG) – valid for 14 days;

It is worth noting that the port system is usually implanted before systemic antitumor drug therapy (chemotherapy), and the set of tests and examinations is identical to those required for chemotherapy. Thus, you will not need to collect them twice. It is only necessary to correctly determine the timing of port placement. Provide the supervising physician with copies of medical documents about the oncological disease and prior treatments.

Preparation for port system placement on the day of the procedure:

  • Be sure to bring your passport and copies of documents if they were not submitted in advance.
  • Have a light breakfast in the morning; then refrain from eating for 6 hours and avoid any liquids for 2 hours before the scheduled port placement time.
  • Take routine medications, except for blood-thinning drugs (this should be agreed with the treating physician in advance).
  • Shower beforehand and, if necessary, remove hair at the implantation site. Note: we recommend wearing dark clothing.


After the procedure

Usually, about 2 hours after port implantation the patient is ready to go home. Within a month one can fully return to normal life. The port system is one of the safest implantable devices: complications occur in less than 2% of patients.

Care recommendations for the port system

A port system can be implanted for a long term (several years or lifelong). With regular use, special care is not required because the system is flushed before and after use.
However, if a break in treatment is planned, the port system should be flushed every 4 weeks. If the patient has entered stable remission, the port system can be removed. The removal procedure is also performed under local anesthesia.

Important:
  • Keep the card with the port system data and diagnosis, as well as the technical passport of the port system. Carry it with you, especially when moving to other cities or countries. Always inform medical personnel about the presence of a port system when undergoing CT or MRI (the port can be used to administer contrast agents).
  • The port system may ONLY be used with special Huber needles. Always confirm their availability with medical staff to avoid deformation of the silicone septum.
  • Symptoms that require immediate medical attention:
    • - burning sensation, pain, fever above 38°C, redness and swelling at the implantation site;
    • - swelling of the arm or bluish discoloration of the skin on the side of the implanted port system;
    • - pain during infusion of medications through the port system.

s7.title: Pathomorphological Studies at PathoLogica Service
s7.about:
PathoLogica Service is a unique remote service offering the full spectrum of pathomorphological studies (cytological, histological, immunohistochemical, molecular-genetic).

Services:
  1. Initial cytological/histological examination.

    Cytological examination involves studying the structure of cells and non-cellular elements to diagnose benign or malignant neoplasms. It is also used to evaluate cellular changes during treatment and for recurrence diagnosis. Advantages include simplicity, minimal invasiveness, relative safety and painless sample collection, and speed of the study.

    Histological examination differs from cytological as it studies tissue samples instead of individual cells. This method is more complex due to multi-level tissue processing and preparation.

    Immunohistochemical, immunocytochemical, and molecular-genetic studies are used if additional diagnostics are needed.
  2. Expert initial cytological/histological examination.

    The study will be conducted by leading experts from PathoLogica Service. International experts may be involved if necessary.

  3. Consultative review of existing cytological/histological samples.

    If you have existing samples (slides, paraffin blocks) previously examined but you doubt the diagnosis and want a second opinion, PathoLogica Service staff will perform a consultative review. Additional consultants may be involved if required.

  4. Expert review of existing cytological/histological samples.

    The consultative review will be performed by leading experts from PathoLogica Service. International experts may be involved if necessary.

    On the day of submission, a courier will collect slides and blocks. The pathologist will review them, organize a consortium with domestic and international specialists if needed, and send a final report with high-resolution digital images of suspicious areas. Convenient, fast, and high-quality!



HOW TO USE PathoLogica Service?
  1. Step 1: Submit an application

    Register in your personal account, provide all necessary information about your current condition, attach existing documents, and fill in delivery details. You can also submit the application with the help of a PathoLogica Service manager at the office.

  2. Step 2: Pay for the study

    After submitting the application on the website, a payment link will be sent to your email. Payment can be made via online services. A digital receipt will be sent to the email provided during payment.

  3. Step 3: Deliver the materials and documents to the courier

    After submitting the application, a PathoLogica Service manager will contact you during working hours to arrange a date and time for courier pick-up. You may also deliver materials to the office yourself after coordinating with the managers.

  4. Step 4: Delivery

    We provide free courier delivery throughout Russia. Delivery takes 1–7 days depending on the distance from Moscow via "Dostavista" or "CDEK" services.

  5. Step 5: Conducting the study

    The study is performed within 2–15 business days from payment, material submission, and document receipt. The final price may change after the first stage depending on workload. Additional blocks, slides, staining, or molecular-genetic tests may increase the cost. The final price will be agreed upon with you.

  6. Step 6: Receiving results and materials

    After completion, we will send the original report, materials, and documents via courier ("Dostavista", "CDEK"). A PDF copy of the report will be sent to your email on the day the study is completed.

s8.title: Digital Diagnosis of Skin Tumors (AI-Assisted Dermatoscopy)
s8.subtitle: Digital Diagnosis of Skin Neoplasms (AI-Assisted Dermatoscopy)
s8.about:
Digital diagnosis of skin neoplasms is a modern, highly accurate method of examining the skin to detect any formations such as moles, pigmented spots, and nevi, and determine whether they are benign or malignant. This computerized examination allows early detection of malignant skin neoplasms, particularly melanoma. Studies show that planned dermatoscopy using AI increases early melanoma detection by 20%.

Why use AI-assisted dermatoscopy?

Digital skin neoplasm diagnosis is applied for:
  • Early detection of malignant skin neoplasms, including melanoma;
  • Differential diagnosis between benign and malignant neoplasms;
  • Detection of parasitic skin conditions (lice, demodicosis, scabies, etc.);
  • Detection of bacterial, viral, and fungal skin infections;
  • Assessment of nail plate condition;
  • Investigating causes of hair loss (alopecia).

When is digital skin neoplasm diagnosis important?

Indications include:
  • Uneven skin growths;
  • Irregular skin color (especially black-blue shades);
  • Changes in size, shape, or color of a lesion;
  • Itching, burning, or pain in a pigmented spot;
  • Bleeding or ulceration of any lesion;
  • High number of moles with light hair color;
  • Moles larger than 0.5 cm in diameter;
  • Appearance of lesions during pregnancy;
  • Lesions in individuals over 60 years old;
  • Family history of melanoma;
  • Pre-surgical assessment of any skin lesion.

Important: These symptoms may be early signs of malignant skin neoplasms. Consultation with a specialist is necessary. Health-Direct’s experienced oncologist-dermatologists conduct comprehensive AI-assisted digital skin diagnosis using the FotoFinder system.

AI-assisted dermatoscopy should be performed annually for individuals at risk of malignant skin neoplasms:
  • Frequent prolonged sun exposure;
  • Repeated trauma to moles or pigmented spots (from clothing, combing, etc.);
  • Regular chemical exposure;
  • Age-related skin changes.


How is digital skin neoplasm diagnosis performed?

No preparation is needed. The patient undresses to underwear, and a special gel is applied. Using the FotoFinder system, the skin is photographed from multiple angles. FotoFinder detects preclinical-stage neoplasms, invisible to the naked eye, with 140x magnification. Examining one lesion takes 1–3 minutes; the full procedure usually lasts about an hour. Data is analyzed in the Moleanalyzer program, which compares the patient’s neoplasms with a global database using AI, generating a report on malignancy, benignity, or borderline nature. AI combined with oncologist-dermatologist expertise provides up to 98% accuracy. Patients receive a detailed report and a mole map to monitor new skin lesions.

Important!

Early detection of malignant skin neoplasms enables minimally invasive treatment with positive outcomes. Care for yourself and loved ones! Perform AI-assisted digital skin diagnosis annually.

Book an appointment via phone +74996853000 or through your personal account at www.health-direct.info.

Cost: 30,000 rubles

s9.title: Molecular Consultation
s9.subtitle: Molecular Consultation
s9.about:
Comprehensive genomic sequencing is increasingly used for various malignant neoplasms. Well-known programs include FoundationOne and OncoAtlas. The main goal of such studies is to identify molecular targets for personalized selection of targeted therapy for malignant tumors when standard therapy is ineffective. Often, patients conduct these studies independently. The result is a multi-page report that can only be interpreted by specialists.

The Health-Direct team offers the “Molecular Consortium” service. Leading specialists in drug therapy and molecular genetics interpret the results of comprehensive genomic sequencing and propose possible personalized targeted treatment options.

s10.title: Expert Evaluation of CT, MRI, PET-CT
s10.subtitle: Expert Evaluation of CT, MRI, PET-CT
s10.about:
Computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and positron emission tomography (PET-CT) are modern radiological diagnostic methods that allow visualization of internal organs, establishing diagnoses, and assessing treatment efficacy. The success of therapy directly depends on correct data interpretation.

If you doubt the accuracy of your report or want a second professional opinion, our specialists can remotely review the radiology results and provide an expert conclusion.

Conveniently, a courier can deliver the disk (for Moscow), or our technical team can upload your data to a cloud storage.

Expert Review Time

3–7 business days depending on case complexity and number of studies. You will receive the conclusion in a PDF format.

s11.title: Medical Assistance
s11.subtitle: Medical Assistance
s11.about:
Treatment success depends on the physician’s involvement. Unfortunately, the healthcare system often involves a multi-step approach where each specialist is limited to their area of responsibility. To ensure nothing is missed, Health-Direct offers an assigned supervising doctor who monitors prescriptions, adequacy of therapy, patient stability, supports relatives, provides care recommendations, and advises on diet. Patients may receive treatment at any medical institution (public or private) while staying in contact and receiving independent evaluation (second opinion).

If treatment opinions differ significantly, Health-Direct refers the patient to trusted specialists and continues to oversee the quality of medical services provided.

s12.title: Voluntary Observation
s12.about: Professional care for bone, joint, and musculoskeletal system conditions — whether due to injury or the need for long-term orthopedic treatment. We use modern surgical and non-surgical methods to restore mobility and reduce pain.

s13.title: Ultrasound Examination
s13.about:
Ultrasound of the abdominal cavity and retroperitoneal space
  • The examination is performed on an empty stomach.
  • If the examination is scheduled in the morning, it is recommended to have a light dinner before 8:00 p.m., and do not eat or drink in the morning.
  • If the examination is scheduled in the evening, a light breakfast is allowed in the morning, but the last meal and fluid intake should be 6–8 hours before the examination.
  • Three days before the examination, a special diet must be followed: exclude flour products, legumes, raw fruits and vegetables, carbonated drinks, and alcohol.
  • The night before the examination, it is recommended to take any absorbent such as activated charcoal, “Smecta”, or “Polysorb”.


Ultrasound of the pelvic organs (transabdominal)
  • The examination must be performed on an empty stomach.
  • If the examination is in the morning, a light dinner is recommended before 8:00 p.m., and no food in the morning.
  • If the examination is scheduled in the evening, a light breakfast is allowed, but the last meal must be 6–8 hours before the procedure.
  • Three days prior to the examination, follow a diet: exclude flour products, legumes, raw fruits and vegetables, carbonated drinks, and alcohol.
  • Before the examination, drink about one liter of water and do not go to the restroom, since ultrasound waves do not pass through air-filled areas, which makes diagnosis difficult. Therefore, the bladder should be full and the intestines free of gases.


Ultrasound of the pelvic organs (transvaginal)
  • The examination must be performed on an empty stomach.
  • If the examination is in the morning, a light dinner is recommended before 8:00 p.m., and no food in the morning.
  • If the examination is scheduled in the evening, a light breakfast is allowed, but the last meal should be no later than 6–8 hours before the examination.
  • It is recommended to refrain from sexual intercourse the day before the procedure, as traces of seminal fluid or condom lubricants may affect the results. If vaginal smears are taken on the same day, their results may also be distorted.


Ultrasound of the pelvic organs (transrectal)
  • For three days before the examination, follow a diet limiting fatty foods and foods that cause gas formation.
  • The examination is performed on an empty stomach with a full bladder.
  • The day before the procedure, take bowel-cleansing medications, and 2–3 hours before the test, perform an enema.

s14.title: Instrumental Examination
s14.about:
Esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD)
  • The examination is performed on an empty stomach.
  • If the procedure is scheduled in the morning, food intake should be stopped the night before.
  • If the examination is scheduled in the afternoon, a light breakfast (yogurt, cottage cheese, juice, unsweetened tea) is allowed.
  • It is important that at least 8 hours pass between the last meal and the procedure.
  • Drinking is almost completely prohibited; no more than 100 ml of water may be consumed 3–4 hours before the examination.
  • Smoking should be avoided on the day of the procedure, as nicotine affects the secretory function of the gastrointestinal tract.


Colonoscopy
  • The most important condition for a high-quality colonoscopy is complete bowel cleansing, so the patient must prepare in advance.
  • Three days before the procedure, it is advisable to avoid foods that cause fermentation or increase bowel activity (whole grain bread, nuts, seeds, dried fruits, raw vegetables, and fruits).
  • The day before the examination, take a special medication (such as lactulose, Fortrans, or Moviprep) to ensure complete bowel cleansing.


PET-CT

Allocate at least 2–3 hours for the procedure.

Before the examination, be sure to inform your doctor of any allergic reactions you may have.

Stage 1 – takes about 70 minutes.

Before the scan, the patient changes into clean clothes and removes all metal objects. Then a radioactive tracer is injected intravenously. This is a quick and painless process. The patient is asked to drink plenty of water and rest in a relaxation room. Within an hour, the tracer spreads throughout the body and accumulates in tumor sites. It is important to remain still and avoid talking during this period.

Stage 2 – takes about 40 minutes.

First, a computed tomography (CT) scan is performed, followed by positron emission tomography (PET). The CT scan takes a few minutes, while the PET scan can take up to half an hour. Both procedures are performed in the same scanner. The patient does not experience any discomfort. In some cases, an additional contrast agent may be administered to improve image quality.
  • Depending on the type of radiopharmaceutical used, the preparation requirements may vary. After consulting your doctor, you will receive detailed individual instructions.

privacy.point1: This Personal Data Processing Policy (hereinafter referred to as the Policy) is developed in accordance with Clause 2, Article 18.1 of the Federal Law of July 27, 2006 No. 152-FZ 'On Personal Data' (hereinafter referred to as the Law on Personal Data) and is a fundamental internal document of LLC 'HD CLINIC' (hereinafter referred to as the Organization), defining key directions of activity in the field of processing and protection of personal data.
privacy.point2: The Policy defines the procedure for processing personal data and measures to ensure their security in LLC 'HD CLINIC', and is developed to implement the requirements of the legislation of the Russian Federation in the field of protecting human and civil rights and freedoms during the processing of personal data, including the protection of the right to privacy, personal, family, and medical confidentiality.
privacy.point3: The provisions of this Policy apply to all relationships related to the processing and protection of personal data obtained by the Organization both before and after the approval of this Policy.
privacy.point4: This Policy is a publicly available document and is published on the official resources of LLC 'HD CLINIC'.
privacy.section2Subtitle: The following terms are used in this document:
privacy.point21: Client (Patient) – an individual who has applied for medical care or uses the Organization’s services.
privacy.point22: Personal Data – any information that directly or indirectly relates to a specific individual.
privacy.point23: Operator – a legal entity that processes personal data and determines the purposes of their processing.
privacy.point24: Processing of Personal Data – any action (operation) performed with or without automation: collection, recording, systematization, storage, clarification, use, transfer, depersonalization, blocking, deletion, or destruction.
privacy.point25: Personal Data Information System – a set of databases and technical tools that ensure the processing of personal data.
privacy.point26: Confidentiality of Personal Data – the requirement not to disclose or distribute personal data without the consent of the subject.
privacy.point27: Protection of Personal Data – a set of legal, organizational, and technical measures aimed at preventing unlawful actions involving personal data.
privacy.section3Subtitle: The processing of personal data by LLC 'HD CLINIC' is carried out solely to achieve specific, lawful purposes, including:
privacy.point34: informing patients about medical services and news of the Organization;
privacy.point35: conducting statistical and scientific medical research (in anonymized form);
privacy.point36: implementing labor legislation with respect to the Organization’s employees;
privacy.point37: fulfilling obligations to regulatory and supervisory authorities;
privacy.point38: organizing access control and ensuring security;
privacy.point39: fulfilling contracts with patients and counterparties.
privacy.section3Text: Only those personal data necessary for the implementation of the above purposes are subject to processing.
privacy.section4Title: Principles and Conditions of Personal Data Processing
privacy.section4Desc:
Personal data processing is carried out on a lawful, fair, and transparent basis and is limited to achieving specific purposes.
Processing of personal data incompatible with the purposes of their collection, as well as merging databases with different processing purposes, is not allowed.

Personal data is stored in a form that allows identifying the subject no longer than required by the purposes of processing or Russian legislation.
Once the purposes are achieved, personal data is destroyed or anonymized.
privacy.section5Title: Categories and Composition of Processed Personal Data
privacy.section5Subtitle: The Organization processes the following categories of personal data:
privacy.point54: passport details (type, number, issuing authority, and date of issue);
privacy.point58: details of compulsory/voluntary medical insurance policy;
privacy.point512: other data necessary for providing medical assistance and fulfilling contractual obligations.
privacy.section5Text: The personal data of employees are determined in accordance with the Labor Code of the Russian Federation.
privacy.section6Title: Legal Grounds for Personal Data Processing
privacy.section6Subtitle: Processing of personal data is carried out based on:
privacy.point61: the Constitution of the Russian Federation;
privacy.point62: the Civil, Labor, and Tax Codes of the Russian Federation;
privacy.point63: Federal Law No. 323-FZ of 21.11.2011 'On the Fundamentals of Health Protection of Citizens in the Russian Federation';
privacy.point64: Federal Law No. 152-FZ of 27.07.2006 'On Personal Data';
privacy.point66: the consent of the personal data subject.
privacy.section7Title: Procedure and Terms of Personal Data Processing
privacy.section7Text:
Processing is carried out both with and without the use of automation tools.

Employees of the Organization have access only to the data necessary for performing their duties.

Data transfer to third parties is allowed only with the written consent of the subject or in cases provided by law.

Cross-border transfer of personal data is not performed by the Organization.
privacy.section8Subtitle: The personal data subject has the right to:
privacy.point81: obtain information about the processing of their personal data;
privacy.point82: demand clarification, blocking, or deletion of personal data;
privacy.point84: appeal the actions or inaction of LLC 'HD CLINIC' to Roskomnadzor or to court;
privacy.point85: require notification of all persons to whom inaccurate or incomplete data were transferred about the corrections made;
privacy.point91: take necessary legal, organizational, and technical measures to protect personal data;
privacy.point92: explain to subjects the consequences of refusing to provide data;
privacy.point93: block or destroy unlawfully processed personal data;
privacy.point94: notify subjects about the elimination of violations;
privacy.point95: appoint a responsible person for organizing personal data processing;
privacy.point96: maintain a record of data subjects’ requests and ensure compliance with personal data legislation.
privacy.section10Title: Measures to Ensure Personal Data Security
privacy.section10Subtitle: To protect personal data, the Organization applies a set of measures:
privacy.point103: encrypting data during transmission over communication networks;
privacy.point105: organizing training for employees authorized to process data;
privacy.point106: storing personal data carriers under conditions preventing unauthorized access;
privacy.point107: conducting internal audits and monitoring compliance with personal data legislation.
privacy.section10Text: Liability for violating personal data legislation requirements is determined in accordance with the current legislation of the Russian Federation.
privacy.section11Subtitle:
This Policy comes into force upon approval by the General Director of LLC 'HD CLINIC' and remains valid indefinitely until replaced by a new edition.
The Policy is publicly available and published in open access on the Organization’s official website.

contract.title: Public Offer Agreement
contract.subtitle: Terms of Paid Medical Services
contract.section1Text:
This Agreement is a public offer in accordance with Article 437 of the Civil Code of the Russian Federation.
Acceptance of this offer is considered the fact of payment for medical services or signing the paid services contract.
contract.section2Text:
The Contractor undertakes to provide medical services as requested by the Customer, and the Customer agrees to pay for these services.
Medical services are provided according to the price list valid at the time of service.
contract.section3Title: Rights and Obligations of the Contractor
contract.responsibleRights: The Contractor has the right to:
contract.contractor1: Request information necessary to provide services
contract.contractor2: Refuse service if medical contraindications exist
contract.contractor3: Amend the price list with notice to the Customer
contract.prohibited1: Provide medical services of proper quality
contract.section4Title: Rights and Obligations of the Customer
contract.customerRights: The Customer has the right to:
contract.customer1: Receive full information about the provided services
contract.customer2: Receive information about their health condition
contract.obliged1: Pay for services in due time
contract.obliged4: Comply with the clinic’s internal regulations
contract.section5Text: The cost of services is determined according to the current price list.
contract.payment2: By bank card via payment terminal
contract.payment4: Online payments through the clinic website
contract.paymentDesc: Payment is made before or immediately after the service, unless otherwise agreed.
contract.section6Text:
The parties are liable for failure or improper fulfillment of obligations under this Agreement in accordance with the laws of the Russian Federation.
The Contractor is not liable for service results if the Customer fails to follow medical recommendations.
contract.section7Text:
All disputes and disagreements are resolved through negotiations.
If no agreement is reached, disputes are resolved in court at the Contractor’s location.
contract.section8Text: The Agreement enters into force upon acceptance of the offer and remains valid until all obligations are fulfilled.
contract.addInfoText: For all contract-related questions, please contact the reception desk.

accordion.careConditionsSubtitle: Scope and conditions of medical care
accordion.careConditionsContent:
Procedure for providing medical care:

Medical care is provided in accordance with the procedures for providing medical care approved by the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation.

Conditions of provision:

• Outpatient (in conditions that do not provide round-the-clock medical supervision and treatment)
• Day hospital (in conditions providing medical supervision and treatment during daytime)
accordion.paidServicesContent:
Conditions for providing paid services:

• Paid medical services are provided on the basis of a contract
• The contract is concluded in writing
• The patient has the right to refuse a paid medical service

Pricing information:

The price list for paid medical services is posted on the information boards of the medical organization and on the official website.

Patient rights:

• Receiving full information about the service and its cost
• Receiving a receipt and a service contract
• Refusing the service before it is provided
accordion.standardsContent:
The doctors at our clinic follow clinical guidelines and standards approved by the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation, in accordance with Federal Law No. 323-FZ “On the Fundamentals of Health Protection of Citizens of the Russian Federation” (Article 37: “Procedures for the Provision of Medical Care and Standards of Medical Care”), as well as the best international practices.

Our specialists adhere to the principles of evidence-based medicine, a personalized approach, and ethical standards of medical practice.

Why are follow-up visits and additional examinations necessary, and what role do they play in making an accurate diagnosis and choosing effective treatment?

We are convinced that a reliable conclusion about a patient's health cannot be formed solely on the basis of complaints and the results of an initial examination. A responsible and professional approach to diagnosis and treatment includes a comprehensive examination based on instrumental and laboratory tests, as well as an analysis of the patient's medical history.

All recommendations you receive in our clinic — including referrals for tests and other diagnostic procedures — are carried out in a volume not less than that required by the standards of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation.

If you have recent test results obtained from other medical institutions, you should present them during your appointment.

This practice allows us to gain a complete understanding of your health status, provide the necessary medical care, and develop an effective and gentle treatment or prevention program, as well as a personalized prevention plan.

You can familiarize yourself with the standards of medical care and clinical guidelines used in the provision of medical services on the “Official Internet Portal of Legal Information” – www.pravo.gov.ru and the official website of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation – https://cr.minzdrav.gov.ru.

Information about the methods of medical care, types of medical interventions, associated risks, consequences, and expected outcomes is provided to patients in an accessible form before the medical intervention, confirmed by signing an informed voluntary consent by the patient or their legal representative.

Waiting time for paid medical services: medical services are provided on the day of the request for medical assistance unless otherwise agreed by the parties and/or required by applicable regulatory acts.

cookie.message: By staying on the website, you agree to the
cookie.heading: Cookie Usage Agreement
cookie.para1: HD Clinic LLC uses cookies — small text files placed on users’ computers for the purpose of analyzing their activity, enabling the proper functioning of this web resource (hereinafter referred to as the site), site navigation, correct operation of services, web analytics, visitor action recordings, tracking traffic sources, and evaluating the effectiveness of online and offline advertising, necessary for advertising and analytical services.
cookie.para2: The site uses the Yandex.Metrica web analytics service provided by Yandex LLC and the google.ru/analytics web analytics service provided by Google LLC. These services use cookie technology. The information collected using cookies (the user's IP address, date and time of the site visit, browser and operating system types, type and model of mobile device, traffic source, information about user behavior on the site including the number and names of viewed pages; age, gender, interests, geographic location of the user, and other technical data) cannot identify you, but may help us improve the site’s performance.
cookie.para3: Information about your use of the site collected through cookies will be transferred to Yandex LLC and Google LLC, which will process this information to evaluate your use of the site, compile reports for us on site activity, and provide other services. Yandex LLC and Google LLC process this information in accordance with the terms of use of their services.
cookie.para4: HD Clinic LLC processes user data in accordance with the “Personal Data Processing Policy.” Some site features may be used without providing personal data. However, to use certain special features of the site, it is necessary to provide some information, including personal data. By staying on the site, you agree to the cookie usage policy.
cookie.footer: You may refuse the use of cookies by selecting the appropriate settings in your browser.
